Ad Text:
Binance is a leading global blockchain ecosystem behind the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume and registered users. We are trusted by over 230 million people in 100+ countries for our industry-leading security, user fund transparency, trading engine speed, deep liquidity, and an unmatched portfolio of digital-asset products. Binance offerings range from trading and finance to education, research, payments, institutional services, Web3 features, and more. We leverage the power of digital assets and blockchain to build an inclusive financial ecosystem to advance the freedom of money and improve financial access for people around the world.

About Binance Accelerator Program

Binance Accelerator Program is a concise fixed-term program designed for Early Career Talent to have an immersive experience in the rapidly expanding Web3 space. You will be given the opportunity to experience life at Binance and understand what goes on behind the scenes of the worlds’ leading blockchain ecosystem. Alongside your job, there will also be a focus on networking and development, which will expand your professional network and build transferable skills to propel you forward in your career. Learn about BAP Program HERE

Who may apply

 Current university students and recent graduates

We are looking for a Web3 × AI Intern to explore, validate, and prototype ideas at the intersection of large language models and decentralized systems.

This role is designed for candidates with a strong research mindset and solid engineering skills, who are interested in understanding where AI truly adds value in Web3 — beyond demos, hype, or surface-level integrations.

You will work closely with engineering and product teams to research emerging directions, build experimental prototypes, and help define next-generation Web3 × AI product paradigms.

Research emerging Web3 × AI directions, Produce structured research notes, technical summaries, or internal presentations including:
AI-powered wallets, trading, and DeFi workflows
AI + on-chain data analytics and intelligence
Intent-based and AI-driven user interaction
Participate in brainstorming sessions, contribute creative ideas, and explore novel approaches to AI-driven Web3 products.
Design, implement, and test experimental prototypes (PoCs) that combine AI with Web3 protocols and products.
Collaborate with engineering, product, and design teams to refine and scale PoCs into production-ready solutions.
Currently pursuing or recently graduated with a degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or related field.
Experience with LLMs, agent frameworks, AI evaluation, benchmarking, or research-style experimentation.
Familiarity with Web3 technologies, blockchain,smart contracts or  DeFi/NFT ecosystems.
Ability to work with ambiguous problems and explore open-ended directions.
Strong analytical thinking and structured communication skills.
Direct exposure to cutting-edge Web3 × AI research and product exploration.
Close collaboration with experienced engineers and product leaders.
High autonomy and a culture that values rigor, experimentation, and critical thinking.
Early involvement in future core product initiatives.
Care deeply about where and why LLMs work in complex systems
Enjoy breaking down systems, building prototypes, and running experiments
Prefer validating ideas with data and code over writing conceptual slides
Want to help define the future interaction model of Web3 products

Why Binance

• Shape the future with the world’s leading blockchain ecosystem

• Collaborate with world-class talent in a user-centric global organization with a flat structure

• Tackle unique, fast-paced projects with autonomy in an innovative environment

• Thrive in a results-driven workplace with opportunities for career growth and continuous learning

• Competitive salary and company benefits

• Work-from-home arrangement (the arrangement may vary depending on the work nature of the business team)

Binance is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. We believe that having a diverse workforce is fundamental to our success.

By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Candidate Privacy Notice.

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

Who may apply

 Current university students and recent graduates

We are seeking a talent on AI/ML to join our Bigdata team. This role offers hands-on experience in developing advanced algorithms for Know Your Customer (KYC) and Know Your Business (KYB) products.

You’ll work on innovative projects involving computer vision, deep learning, and large language models (LLMs) to tackle real-world challenges in identity verification and fraud detection.

This talent is ideal for Master/PhD students passionate about AI and eager to contribute to high-impact fintech solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the team to design, implement, and optimize algorithms for KYC/KYB processes, including Optical Character Recognition (OCR), face recognition, image quality assurance, and document tampering detection.
Apply traditional deep learning techniques to improve model accuracy and efficiency in image processing and analysis.
Leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance algorithm capabilities, such as integrating multimodal AI for better document understanding and anomaly detection.
Conduct experiments, analyze data, and iterate on models to ensure robustness and scalability in production environments.
Assist in research and development of new features to strengthen Binance’s compliance and security frameworks.
Participate in code reviews, team meetings, and knowledge-sharing sessions to foster a collaborative environment.
Qualifications and Requirements

Currently enrolled in a PhD program (or equivalent advanced degree) in Computer Science (CS), Electrical Engineering (EE), Information Systems (IS), or a related field at a top university.
Strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and AI frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
A big plus: Experience or coursework in computer vision, including techniques for image processing, object detection, or facial recognition.
Familiarity with LLMs and their applications in multimodal tasks is highly desirable.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, with experience in data processing libraries (e.g., OpenCV, NumPy, Pandas).
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently or in a team.
Passion for blockchain, fintech, or AI ethics is a bonus.
